summary: This is a sealed application and order from the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York, authorizing the FBI to install a pen register and trap-and-trace device on a phone line subscribed to 'TERRAMAR PROJECT' (phone number 917-520-3106). The surveillance is part of a criminal investigation into possible violations of 18 U.S.C. ยง 1591 (sex trafficking) involving 'FNU LNU and others known and unknown'.

persons.name: Alex Rossmiller
persons.context: The attorney who submitted the sealed application to the court, affirming the facts and requesting the surveillance order on behalf of the U.S. government.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, whose office Alex Rossmiller works for.

persons.name: Stewart D. Aaron
persons.context: The judge who signed the order authorizing the use of the pen register and trap-and-trace device.

connections.description: Rossmiller is an Assistant U.S. Attorney working in the office of U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman.

events.title: Court Order for Pen Register
events.description: A U.S. Magistrate Judge signed an order authorizing the FBI to install a pen register and trap-and-trace device on a phone line subscribed to 'TERRAMAR PROJECT' for 60 days.

keyFacts: The FBI was conducting a criminal investigation into possible violations of 18 U.S.C. ยง 1591 (sex trafficking) involving 'FNU LNU and others known and unknown'.
The target of the surveillance was a T-Mobile phone line (917-520-3106) subscribed to an entity named 'TERRAMAR PROJECT'.
The court authorized the surveillance for a period of 60 days from December 31, 2019, to collect non-content information like phone numbers, IP addresses, and call times.
The application and order were sealed, and the provider (T-Mobile) was ordered not to disclose the existence of the investigation.
The primary subject of the investigation is listed as 'FNU LNU' (First Name Unknown, Last Name Unknown), indicating law enforcement was investigating an unidentified individual at this stage.
